result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Leonard Jerome Mida was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY
  IID for a period of 2 yrs to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.

miscConds.notes:
Jail sentence with Huber privileges may be served in Pierce, Pepin, St Croix, Dunn or Polk County.
Huber is allowed after 1st 48 hours for treatment and doctor appointments.

Def must complete Victim Impact Panel with SCVRJP within 1 year.
Provide DNA Sample.
AODA and Driver Safey Plan

timeConds.notes: If sheriff allows, sentence may be served on home monitoring.

records.addlTxt:
4:08  Defendant Leonard Jerome Mida in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Nelson files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form.  Plead to 5th off S/W Probation.  Froelich agrees with this. Court reviews the plea questionnaire and waiver for rights with the defendant. Defendant will plead to Count 2 of the information.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 2    Dismiss CT 1      .0188 TEST
Court orders S/W Probation 3 years
  Fine  $ 2122.00  over the course of probation includes DNA surcharge. 
 24  Month Revocation of License
 180  Days Jail stayed 6- 5-2015  until  at 7:00 P.M. If sheriff allows it may be served on home monitoring. 
 Huber is allowed after the first 48 hours for treatment and doctor appts. 
 Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan
 IID for 2 years.and $50.00surcharge IID commences when the Def. obtains any DL, or decides to drive w/o valid DL.
Defendant must complete the victim impact panel within the next year. 
DNA sample must be given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-06-2015 04:00 pm.

11:35 Defendant Leonard Jerome Mida in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court: gives decision on motion filed by Atty Nelson. Finds the time of arrest, failure to dim headlights, Officer knew the defendant had a previous driving offence, blood shot eyes, HGN and walk the line test give way to PBT request. Denies Atty Nelson's motion filed on behalf of Defendant. Set for next hearing.
